values.description: gcc6 testing in debian found [a problem with gazebo_physics library](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=831176). We miss to include boost regexp library (used in the [WordState files](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/ca2a71952a3823494afe2aafe9b6996c40e31539/gazebo/physics/WorldState.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#WorldState.hh-87)) into the linking process (is one of the few boost libraries which is not header only).
values.title: Include Boost_LIBRARIES  in the linking of gazebo_physics

summary.raw: gcc6 testing in debian found [a problem with gazebo_physics library](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=831176). We miss to include boost regexp library (used in the [WordState files](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/ca2a71952a3823494afe2aafe9b6996c40e31539/gazebo/physics/WorldState.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#WorldState.hh-87)) into the linking process (is one of the few boost libraries which is not header only).
summary.html: gcc6 testing in debian found a problem with gazebo_physics library. We miss to include boost regexp library (used in the WordState files) into the linking process (is one of the few boost libraries which is not header only).

values.description:
We currently have conversion functions between gazebo::msg and SDF, in [gazebo::msgs::msgs.hh](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/ca2a71952a3823494afe2aafe9b6996c40e31539/gazebo/msgs/msgs.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default). As we move to ign-msgs, I propose we add the equivalent conversion functions to `util::IgnMsgSdf`, in the following format:

* **ign-msgs -> SDF**: `gazebo::util::<msg type>IgnMsgToSdf`
* **SDF -> ign-msgs**: `gazebo::util::<msg type>SdfToIgnMsg`

Suggestions are very welcome.
values.title: Conversion between ign msg and sdf, for plugin

summary.raw:
We currently have conversion functions between gazebo::msg and SDF, in [gazebo::msgs::msgs.hh](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/ca2a71952a3823494afe2aafe9b6996c40e31539/gazebo/msgs/msgs.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default). As we move to ign-msgs, I propose we add the equivalent conversion functions to `util::IgnMsgSdf`, in the following format:

* **ign-msgs -> SDF**: `gazebo::util::<msg type>IgnMsgToSdf`
* **SDF -> ign-msgs**: `gazebo::util::<msg type>SdfToIgnMsg`

Suggestions are very welcome.
summary.html:
We currently have conversion functions between gazebo::msg and SDF, in gazebo::msgs::msgs.hh. As we move to ign-msgs, I propose we add the equivalent conversion functions to util::IgnMsgSdf, in the following format:

  • ign-msgs -> SDF: gazebo::util::<msg type>IgnMsgToSdf
  • SDF -> ign-msgs: gazebo::util::<msg type>SdfToIgnMsg

Suggestions are very welcome.

values.description: This deprecates two `gazebo::math` classes that were very lightly used (`Kmeans` and `Filter`). While testing the fixes for `Filter`, I noticed that the Hydra plugins weren't actually being built anymore, so that was fixed in c90fa45. I then noticed that many of the helper functions in `gazebo/math/Helpers.hh` were unused or lightly used, so I deprecated many of them as well.
values.title: Deprecate more gazebo::math classes

summary.raw: This deprecates two `gazebo::math` classes that were very lightly used (`Kmeans` and `Filter`). While testing the fixes for `Filter`, I noticed that the Hydra plugins weren't actually being built anymore, so that was fixed in c90fa45. I then noticed that many of the helper functions in `gazebo/math/Helpers.hh` were unused or lightly used, so I deprecated many of them as well.
summary.html: This deprecates two gazebo::math classes that were very lightly used (Kmeans and Filter). While testing the fixes for Filter, I noticed that the Hydra plugins weren't actually being built anymore, so that was fixed in c90fa45. I then noticed that many of the helper functions in gazebo/math/Helpers.hh were unused or lightly used, so I deprecated many of them as well.

values.description:
A collada file with multiple texture coordinates specified in a polylist will cause gazebo to crash. See included example DAE file.

This fixes the crash, but does not add rendering support for multiple texture maps. See issue #532.

values.description:
Backported from pull request #2264.

You can test it by loading the following world, then opening the Topic Viewer and checking the `~/keyboard/keypress` topic.

~~~
<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<sdf version="1.5">
  <world name="default">
    <gui>
      <plugin name="keyboard" filename="libKeyboardGUIPlugin.so"/>
    </gui>
  </world>
</sdf>
~~~
values.title: KeyboardGUIPlugin -> 7

values.description:
* Consistently set symbol export definitions

    Updated each gazebo library CMakeLists.txt to consistently set the
    -DBUILDING_DLL_GZ_* definitions using CMake add_defintions.  Also made
    sure that the definitions were always being set; some were only
    set when WIN32 was defined.

* Fix linking of libgazebo_player

    Link missing libraries to libgazebo_player, and remove gazebo.cc
    from libgazebo_player's source file list.

    Resolves issue #2025

* Remove gazebo_player from PKG_LIBRARIES

    Remove gazebo_player from the PKG_LIBRARIES list of exported libraries.
    gazebo_player is a plugin library meant to be dlopened by Player, it
    does not export any ABI that's useful to other third-party projects.

    Resolves issue #2026
values.title: Visibility and Player fixes

summary.raw:
* Consistently set symbol export definitions

    Updated each gazebo library CMakeLists.txt to consistently set the
    -DBUILDING_DLL_GZ_* definitions using CMake add_defintions.  Also made
    sure that the definitions were always being set; some were only
    set when WIN32 was defined.

* Fix linking of libgazebo_player

    Link missing libraries to libgazebo_player, and remove gazebo.cc
    from libgazebo_player's source file list.

    Resolves issue #2025

* Remove gazebo_player from PKG_LIBRARIES

    Remove gazebo_player from the PKG_LIBRARIES list of exported libraries.
    gazebo_player is a plugin library meant to be dlopened by Player, it
    does not export any ABI that's useful to other third-party projects.

    Resolves issue #2026
summary.html:
• Consistently set symbol export definitions

    Updated each gazebo library CMakeLists.txt to consistently set the -DBUILDING_DLL_GZ_* definitions using CMake add_defintions. Also made sure that the definitions were always being set; some were only set when WIN32 was defined.

  • Fix linking of libgazebo_player

    Link missing libraries to libgazebo_player, and remove gazebo.cc from libgazebo_player's source file list.

    Resolves issue #2025

  • Remove gazebo_player from PKG_LIBRARIES

    Remove gazebo_player from the PKG_LIBRARIES list of exported libraries. gazebo_player is a plugin library meant to be dlopened by Player, it does not export any ABI that's useful to other third-party projects.

    Resolves issue #2026

values.description:
This is migrating the functionality added in pull request #2323 to use an ignition transport service rather than gazebo transport requests. 

This is supposed to have better performance than the previous approach, because we don't have a subscriber to `~/response` for each model, link, sensor, visual in the world.

The world provides a service, `<world_name>/server/info/plugin`, which is the single point of entry for all plugin info queries within the server (World, Model, Sensor plugins). Potentially even Visual plugins, since the SDF is within the world.

This pull request changes the logic for model plugins, and future pull requests will use the same approach for other plugin types.

I hope other details are made clear in the documentation.

Obs: There is a [compile warning](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/569/warnings19Result/) left which I need help with.
values.title: Get plugin info with Ignition transport service

This is supposed to have better performance than the previous approach, because we don't have a subscriber to `~/response` for each model, link, sensor, visual in the world.

The world provides a service, `<world_name>/server/info/plugin`, which is the single point of entry for all plugin info queries within the server (World, Model, Sensor plugins). Potentially even Visual plugins, since the SDF is within the world.

This pull request changes the logic for model plugins, and future pull requests will use the same approach for other plugin types.

I hope other details are made clear in the documentation.

summary.html:
This is migrating the functionality added in pull request #2323 to use an ignition transport service rather than gazebo transport requests.

This is supposed to have better performance than the previous approach, because we don't have a subscriber to ~/response for each model, link, sensor, visual in the world.

The world provides a service, <world_name>/server/info/plugin, which is the single point of entry for all plugin info queries within the server (World, Model, Sensor plugins). Potentially even Visual plugins, since the SDF is within the world.

This pull request changes the logic for model plugins, and future pull requests will use the same approach for other plugin types.

I hope other details are made clear in the documentation.

Obs: There is a compile warning left which I need help with.

values.description:
Remove all gazebo7 deprecations, I thought this could shave some seconds (hopefully minutes) from the build time. Hard to tell from the Jenkins jobs, I think they keep the workspace from previous runs...

Although they were deprecated, I couldn't just remove `Camera::SetWorldPose` and `Camera::MoveToPosition`, because they are still used by derived classes:

![jenkinsdep.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/108008361-jenkinsdep.png)

So:

* Changed `Camera::SetWorldPose` and `UserCamera::SetWorldPose` to be deprecated in Gazebo8

* Removed `UserCamera::MoveToPosition` and `OculusCamera::MoveToPosition`, because those were just calling the original function.

# CI

* [Homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/623/) is satisfied
values.title: Remove all Gazebo7 deprecations

summary.raw:
Remove all gazebo7 deprecations, I thought this could shave some seconds (hopefully minutes) from the build time. Hard to tell from the Jenkins jobs, I think they keep the workspace from previous runs...

Although they were deprecated, I couldn't just remove `Camera::SetWorldPose` and `Camera::MoveToPosition`, because they are still used by derived classes:

![jenkinsdep.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/108008361-jenkinsdep.png)

So:

* Changed `Camera::SetWorldPose` and `UserCamera::SetWorldPose` to be deprecated in Gazebo8

* Removed `UserCamera::MoveToPosition` and `OculusCamera::MoveToPosition`, because those were just calling the original function.

# CI

* [Homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/623/) is satisfied
summary.html:
Remove all gazebo7 deprecations, I thought this could shave some seconds (hopefully minutes) from the build time. Hard to tell from the Jenkins jobs, I think they keep the workspace from previous runs...

Although they were deprecated, I couldn't just remove Camera::SetWorldPose and Camera::MoveToPosition, because they are still used by derived classes:

So:

  • Changed Camera::SetWorldPose and UserCamera::SetWorldPose to be deprecated in Gazebo8

  • Removed UserCamera::MoveToPosition and OculusCamera::MoveToPosition, because those were just calling the original function.

CI

  • Homebrew is satisfied

values.description:
Buildcop found the collada_visualization test was failing.

This PR changes the test from relying on a pixel buffer to counting triangles.

[Nvidia](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/588/) - Compiler warnings have been fixed.

[Homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/627/) :large_blue_circle:

values.description:
The `HarnessPlugin` suffers from a race condition when calling detaching the harness joint, as described in #2034. This pull request reduces the likelihood of that race condition and fixes several other things as well.

1. The `HarnessPlugin` has an example world [worlds/harness.world](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/gazebo7/worlds/harness.world),
but it didn't have a test, so I've added an integration test.

2. In order to write the test, I wanted to be able to get a `JointPtr` for the harness joint by calling `Model::GetJoint`, but that wasn't possible since the joint wasn't being added to the `Model::joints` vector (similar to issue #1217). The `Model::CreateJoint()` function added in pull request #1938 couldn't be used easily by the `HarnessPlugin` though since it doesn't take an `sdf::ElementPtr` as in input. So, I added a new `Model::CreateJoint(sdf::ElementPtr)` function in 784ecce and use it in the `HarnessPlugin` in 48a49d5.

3. Using the new `CreateJoint` function temporarily broke harness detachment, so I had to add `JointController::RemoveJoint` (da0f4f4) and add a `Joint::Fini` call in `Model::RemoveJoint` (deb6ef3). That was able to fix the harness detachment.

3. The new test verifies both the velocity and detach topics. To address the race condition, the `DetachUnpaused` test unthrottles the real-time update rate so that failures are more common. To see these failures, build ef4cc51 and run the test several times.

4. I fixed the race condition in #2034 by setting `winchIndex` to `-1` in `OnDetach` then calling the `Detach` function from the `Update` function if the `winchIndex` is less than zero. This ensures the joint will be deleted in the main World::Runloop thread.

5. Though not reported in an issue, I noticed that gazebo would crash if sent additional velocity or detachment messages after the joint had already been detached, so I fixed that in 9092468.
values.title: Add test for HarnessPlugin, reduce likelihood of race condition (#2034)

summary.raw:
The `HarnessPlugin` suffers from a race condition when calling detaching the harness joint, as described in #2034. This pull request reduces the likelihood of that race condition and fixes several other things as well.

1. The `HarnessPlugin` has an example world [worlds/harness.world](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/gazebo7/worlds/harness.world),
but it didn't have a test, so I've added an integration test.

2. In order to write the test, I wanted to be able to get a `JointPtr` for the harness joint by calling `Model::GetJoint`, but that wasn't possible since the joint wasn't being added to the `Model::joints` vector (similar to issue #1217). The `Model::CreateJoint()` function added in pull request #1938 couldn't be used easily by the `HarnessPlugin` though since it doesn't take an `sdf::ElementPtr` as in input. So, I added a new `Model::CreateJoint(sdf::ElementPtr)` function in 784ecce and use it in the `HarnessPlugin` in 48a49d5.

3. Using the new `CreateJoint` function temporarily broke harness detachment, so I had to add `JointController::RemoveJoint` (da0f4f4) and add a `Joint::Fini` call in `Model::RemoveJoint` (deb6ef3). That was able to fix the harness detachment.

3. The new test verifies both the velocity and detach topics. To address the race condition, the `DetachUnpaused` test unthrottles the real-time update rate so that failures are more common. To see these failures, build ef4cc51 and run the test several times.

4. I fixed the race condition in #2034 by setting `winchIndex` to `-1` in `OnDetach` then calling the `Detach` function from the `Update` function if the `winchIndex` is less than zero. This ensures the joint will be deleted in the main World::Runloop thread.

5. Though not reported in an issue, I noticed that gazebo would crash if sent additional velocity or detachment messages after the joint had already been detached, so I fixed that in 9092468.
summary.html:
The HarnessPlugin suffers from a race condition when calling detaching the harness joint, as described in #2034. This pull request reduces the likelihood of that race condition and fixes several other things as well.

  1. The HarnessPlugin has an example world worlds/harness.world, but it didn't have a test, so I've added an integration test.

  2. In order to write the test, I wanted to be able to get a JointPtr for the harness joint by calling Model::GetJoint, but that wasn't possible since the joint wasn't being added to the Model::joints vector (similar to issue #1217). The Model::CreateJoint() function added in pull request #1938 couldn't be used easily by the HarnessPlugin though since it doesn't take an sdf::ElementPtr as in input. So, I added a new Model::CreateJoint(sdf::ElementPtr) function in 784ecce and use it in the HarnessPlugin in 48a49d5.

  3. Using the new CreateJoint function temporarily broke harness detachment, so I had to add JointController::RemoveJoint (da0f4f4) and add a Joint::Fini call in Model::RemoveJoint (deb6ef3). That was able to fix the harness detachment.

  4. The new test verifies both the velocity and detach topics. To address the race condition, the DetachUnpaused test unthrottles the real-time update rate so that failures are more common. To see these failures, build ef4cc51 and run the test several times.

  5. I fixed the race condition in #2034 by setting winchIndex to -1 in OnDetach then calling the Detach function from the Update function if the winchIndex is less than zero. This ensures the joint will be deleted in the main World::Runloop thread.

  6. Though not reported in an issue, I noticed that gazebo would crash if sent additional velocity or detachment messages after the joint had already been detached, so I fixed that in 9092468.

values.description:
The inclusion of protobuf3 in Debian [triggered a compilation failure](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/debian/job/gazebo-pkg_builder-master-debian_sid-amd64/52/consoleFull#-18454047746ea37b8d-a6d4-40ae-8431-d90c018842af) with a duplicate "Status" keyword. One is coming from `<X11/Xlib.h>` (using a #define) and the other one is coming from a protobuf class.

I've undef the Status coming from `<X11/Xlib.h>`.
values.title: Fix SpaceNav compilation for protobuf3. Remove Status redefinition (gazebo7)

summary.raw:
The inclusion of protobuf3 in Debian [triggered a compilation failure](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/debian/job/gazebo-pkg_builder-master-debian_sid-amd64/52/consoleFull#-18454047746ea37b8d-a6d4-40ae-8431-d90c018842af) with a duplicate "Status" keyword. One is coming from `<X11/Xlib.h>` (using a #define) and the other one is coming from a protobuf class.

I've undef the Status coming from `<X11/Xlib.h>`.
summary.html:
The inclusion of protobuf3 in Debian triggered a compilation failure with a duplicate "Status" keyword. One is coming from <X11/Xlib.h> (using a #define) and the other one is coming from a protobuf class.

I've undef the Status coming from <X11/Xlib.h>.

values.description:
This requires [this](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/pull-requests/125/backport-from-default-to-ign-math2-and-fix/diff) ign-math pull request to use `ignition::math::Triangle3d`.

After this, the only gazebo::math left in gui is in deprecated functions.

values.description:
Several fixes to gazebo windows compilation:

* Fixes to ignition transport compilation in windows

* Include ign-transport directories in utils

* Support for ignition-transport2 in cmake (already done for gazebo7 in other PR)

* Added support for ignition-msgs to configure.bat

* Fix paths for ignition packages

* Implement qwt windows detection

The [test build reached about the 60%](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/903/console) and found problems with ign-msgs. That will go in other PR.
values.title: Fix gazebo windows configuration and dependencies

values.description:
issue #1837 - setting a non-supported value causes depth rendering issue on VMware. 

The fix should be ABI compatible and can be merged forward to gazebo7. I would like to move this check to [RenderEngine](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/651b6b1fc78b05ae2825d3771371f6824f83e579/gazebo/rendering/RenderEngine.cc?at=gazebo_2.2&fileviewer=file-view-default#RenderEngine.cc-658) on `default` since it's also setting `fsaa` (but don't seem to cause problem yet) and provide an accessor methods for the `Camera` class to get the supported values.

jenkins: 

[nvidia-gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/617/) - ok. Style errors fixed in 	5a290d2
values.title: Check FSAA support when creating camera render textures

summary.raw:
issue #1837 - setting a non-supported value causes depth rendering issue on VMware. 

The fix should be ABI compatible and can be merged forward to gazebo7. I would like to move this check to [RenderEngine](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/651b6b1fc78b05ae2825d3771371f6824f83e579/gazebo/rendering/RenderEngine.cc?at=gazebo_2.2&fileviewer=file-view-default#RenderEngine.cc-658) on `default` since it's also setting `fsaa` (but don't seem to cause problem yet) and provide an accessor methods for the `Camera` class to get the supported values.

jenkins: 

[nvidia-gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/617/) - ok. Style errors fixed in 	5a290d2
summary.html:
issue #1837 - setting a non-supported value causes depth rendering issue on VMware.

The fix should be ABI compatible and can be merged forward to gazebo7. I would like to move this check to RenderEngine on default since it's also setting fsaa (but don't seem to cause problem yet) and provide an accessor methods for the Camera class to get the supported values.

jenkins:

nvidia-gpu - ok. Style errors fixed in 5a290d2

values.description:
This version of video recording has the following features:

1. Record to mp4 file
2. Record to ogv file
3. Record to avi file
4. Record to /dev/video (Xenial only) - Instructions below

## Record to /dev/video

This feature requires a video 4 linux2 loopback device.

1. `sudo apt-get install v4l2loopback-dkms`
2. `sudo modprobe v4l2loopback`

        At this point you should have a `/dev/video0` device file.

3. Start gazebo, and choose the `v4l` recording option
4. In a terminal start `xawtv` to see the output (`sudo apt-get install xawtv`)

This will not work on trusty because the available version of ffmpeg does not support output to a video4linux loopback device. You can try compiling and installing a new version of ffmpeg from source.
values.title: Screen recoder encode

summary.raw:
This version of video recording has the following features:

1. Record to mp4 file
2. Record to ogv file
3. Record to avi file
4. Record to /dev/video (Xenial only) - Instructions below

## Record to /dev/video

This feature requires a video 4 linux2 loopback device.

1. `sudo apt-get install v4l2loopback-dkms`
2. `sudo modprobe v4l2loopback`

        At this point you should have a `/dev/video0` device file.

3. Start gazebo, and choose the `v4l` recording option
4. In a terminal start `xawtv` to see the output (`sudo apt-get install xawtv`)

This will not work on trusty because the available version of ffmpeg does not support output to a video4linux loopback device. You can try compiling and installing a new version of ffmpeg from source.
summary.html:
This version of video recording has the following features:

  1. Record to mp4 file
  2. Record to ogv file
  3. Record to avi file
  4. Record to /dev/video (Xenial only) - Instructions below

Record to /dev/video

This feature requires a video 4 linux2 loopback device.

  1. sudo apt-get install v4l2loopback-dkms

  2. sudo modprobe v4l2loopback

    At this point you should have a `/dev/video0` device file.

  3. Start gazebo, and choose the v4l recording option

  4. In a terminal start xawtv to see the output (sudo apt-get install xawtv)

This will not work on trusty because the available version of ffmpeg does not support output to a video4linux loopback device. You can try compiling and installing a new version of ffmpeg from source.

values.description:
This reduces some console spam on OS X when loading gzclient:

~~~
[Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:99] libpng warning: iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile
[Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:99] libpng warning: iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile
[Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:99] libpng warning: iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile
[Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:99] libpng warning: iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile
...
~~~

Per this [stackoverflow post](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/22745076/libpng-warning-iccp-known-incorrect-srgb-profile) I used imagemagick to convert the offending png files, and the warning messages no longer appear.
values.title: remove iCCP profiles from png files to prevent libpng console warnings

summary.raw:
This reduces some console spam on OS X when loading gzclient:

~~~
[Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:99] libpng warning: iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile
[Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:99] libpng warning: iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile
[Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:99] libpng warning: iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile
[Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:99] libpng warning: iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile
...
~~~

Per this [stackoverflow post](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/22745076/libpng-warning-iccp-known-incorrect-srgb-profile) I used imagemagick to convert the offending png files, and the warning messages no longer appear.
summary.html:
This reduces some console spam on OS X when loading gzclient:

[Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:99] libpng warning: iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile
[Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:99] libpng warning: iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile
[Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:99] libpng warning: iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile
[Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:99] libpng warning: iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile
...

Per this stackoverflow post I used imagemagick to convert the offending png files, and the warning messages no longer appear.

values.description: A collada file could have multiple texture coordinates with identical offsets. This would cause gazebo to crash. We now use a `std::set` instead of a `std::vector` to handle this case.
values.title: Fix multiple texcoords

summary.raw: A collada file could have multiple texture coordinates with identical offsets. This would cause gazebo to crash. We now use a `std::set` instead of a `std::vector` to handle this case.
summary.html: A collada file could have multiple texture coordinates with identical offsets. This would cause gazebo to crash. We now use a std::set instead of a std::vector to handle this case.

values.description:
This pull request aims at fixing the camera hiccups during tracking of a visual. The most significant changes it introduces are:

* Update the camera state during prerender instead of postrender. Knowing that the pose of the visuals is updated during prerender, it makes more sense to update the pose of the camera during that event as well.
* Use Ogre autotracking feature to automatically rotate the camera to look at the target.
* Remove the PIDs.

All those changes seem necessary to make the tracking as smooth as possible.
values.title: Fix camera hiccups in tracking mode

summary.raw:
This pull request aims at fixing the camera hiccups during tracking of a visual. The most significant changes it introduces are:

* Update the camera state during prerender instead of postrender. Knowing that the pose of the visuals is updated during prerender, it makes more sense to update the pose of the camera during that event as well.
* Use Ogre autotracking feature to automatically rotate the camera to look at the target.
* Remove the PIDs.

All those changes seem necessary to make the tracking as smooth as possible.
summary.html:
This pull request aims at fixing the camera hiccups during tracking of a visual. The most significant changes it introduces are:

  • Update the camera state during prerender instead of postrender. Knowing that the pose of the visuals is updated during prerender, it makes more sense to update the pose of the camera during that event as well.
  • Use Ogre autotracking feature to automatically rotate the camera to look at the target.
  • Remove the PIDs.

All those changes seem necessary to make the tracking as smooth as possible.

values.description:
Add support for plotting topic data.

Only numeric fields can be plotted.

**Note:** Not all msgs contain a timestamp. The plotting tool will look for a `time` or `stamp` field in the msg and use it as the x value if it exists. Otherwise it'll plot the data against the nearest sim time obtained through `~/world_stats` topic - which unfortunately produces plots with incorrect x values! Suggestions on improving the current behavior are welcome.
values.title: Plotting: Topics

summary.raw:
Add support for plotting topic data.

Only numeric fields can be plotted.

**Note:** Not all msgs contain a timestamp. The plotting tool will look for a `time` or `stamp` field in the msg and use it as the x value if it exists. Otherwise it'll plot the data against the nearest sim time obtained through `~/world_stats` topic - which unfortunately produces plots with incorrect x values! Suggestions on improving the current behavior are welcome.
summary.html:
Add support for plotting topic data.

Only numeric fields can be plotted.

Note: Not all msgs contain a timestamp. The plotting tool will look for a time or stamp field in the msg and use it as the x value if it exists. Otherwise it'll plot the data against the nearest sim time obtained through ~/world_stats topic - which unfortunately produces plots with incorrect x values! Suggestions on improving the current behavior are welcome.

values.description:
add a function to get all FSAA levels so it can be used in `Camera` and `RenderEngine` class for setting FSAA. 

See pull request #2442 for a similar fix for `gazebo5`. This PR provides a more general solution but uses a new member variable `fsaaLevels` which would break ABI if done in `gazebo5`,

values.description:
* add settings for fdm ports and address per pull request #2451
* add ardupilot irlock plugin and demo world
* update models and demo worlds, make landing pad heavier in demo world, add zephyr test world
* update irlock plugin for Copter-3.4rc5, update beacon and model
* fix sensor plugin destructor segfault
* add ArduPilotPlugin, deprecate ArduCopterPlugin.
* fix receive packet size checking in ArduPilotPlugin.
* fix frame transforms (bug uncovered by zephyr model)
* rename param (`modelXYZToNED` --> `gazeboXYZToNED`) which is the transform from gazebo model frame to 
* adjust clamp for incoming commands to [-1, 1]

values.description:
This PR make ardupilot socket parametrable via model.sdf . It allows to launch multi ardupilot sitl and connect it to gazebo : see https://github.com/ArduPilot/ardupilot/pull/4883 and https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8RFJ-ax-CWk

I also correct some error trigger by code_check.sh 
I make the changes in arducopter & ardupilot plugin. It works in arducopter but I didn't achieved to make quad takeoff with ardupilot plugin ... ( I look at zephyr model change but without success... see https://gist.github.com/khancyr/a321eee82d14b3df5efb789c302bd589)
values.title: Ardupilot: Make ardupilot address parametrable && style update
